msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the top, right and bottom sides. The beginning of the column is lost. The papyrus is broken at: the middle of the column, the end of the lines, the payments, between the col. 161 and 162 and the beginning of column 162 as a result of vertical folds. Generaly the papyrus divided in two pieces: the main part, which contains col. 161 and the beginning of col. 162, which has a dark brown color, and a small vertical piece that contains the payments of col. 162, which has a light brown color. A big spot of ink ison Verso. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Ptolemaios, son of Phasis, grandson of Petheus, mother Tanais (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Kastor, the son, mother Tapasion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 182)
Phaesis, mother Tapetsiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 238, 244)
Kommon, son of Onnophris, grandson of Satabous, mother Ptolema (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 183)
Pasion, the brother, the same mother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 198)
Horos, son of Karanos, grandson of Herakles, mother Artemis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Sabinus, son of Apynchis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
